results.definition: the part of a piece of clothing that covers the thighs
examples: his lap was covered with food stains
The cat lapped up the milk
the dog's laps were warm and wet

results.definition: a flap that lies over another part
examples: the lap of the shingles should be at least ten inches
he drove an extra lap just for insurance

results.definition: move with or cause to move with a whistling or hissing sound
an area of control or responsibility
examples: the job fell right in my lap

results.definition: lie partly over or alongside of something or of one another
the upper side of the thighs of a seated person
examples: he picked up the little girl and plopped her down in his lap
